result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant Anthony L. Walstra was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 4th Degree Sexual Assault, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3m).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: the defendant shall obtain a high school diploma, HSED or it's equivalent;  Must obtain/maintain full-time employment or schooling or a combination of both
Shall undergo and follow through with any counseling as directed by agent
Shall have no unsupervised contact with minor females; no sexual contact with minors;

timeConds.notes: Consecutive to: to sentence currently serving;  with work release and transfer privileges

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Anthony L. Walstra

records.addlTxt: Defendant, Anthony L. Walstra in court, Yolanda J. Tienstra appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State is compliant with victim notification; Agent Amanda Walters appears by phone; discussion held whether def should remain on supervision; restitution to victim has been paid in full; restitution to insurance company still owed; parties heard; Court heard civil judgment for any unpaid restitution; Court will not approve of any settlement; restitution to be paid in full;

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Defendant Anthony L. Walstra in court with attorney Greg Ernest Vollan.  Yolanda J. Tienstra appeared for the State of Wisconsin. This is restitution hearing; Atty. Vollan heard - amount is not in dispute, but the issue is Def.'s ability to pay; victim, S.S. is now on the phone; State heard on restitution: 1. $100 to Crime Victim Compensation - Def. does have ability to pay and will pay within term of probation; 2. $684.70 to victim, S.S. - Def. does have ability to pay and will pay within term of probation;  3. $19,536.80 to Dean Health Plan - Def. does not dispute and cannot pay; Court orders Def. to pay 1. & 2.; discussion on #3 and ability to pay/when/future earning ability; victim heard; Court orders that the amounts due to victim (#2) are to be paid before any other restitution ordered; victim requests that her address be kept confidential; State notes Def. is on DPA in Count 1 - payments would go through their office and be disbursed; Atty. Vollan calls Def., s/t; witness excused; State argument; Atty. Vollan argument; Court heard and finds Def. probably should be able to pay $250/mo. toward restitution; Court orders that comm. in May, 2016 that Def. pay at least $250/mo. toward restitution; Def. may request hearing if circumstances change

Defendant Anthony L. Walstra in court with attorney Greg E. Vollan.  Yolanda J. Tienstra appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State is victim rights compliant.  Victim's mother sworn and makes stmt.  Court questions def and reviews chgs and pens.  NC plea entered in Counts 1 & 2 of the Amended Information.  Cout accepts plea and withholds finding of guilt in Count 1 and places def on DPA;  court accepts plea and finds def guilty in Count 2.  Atty Tienstra heard on sentencing recomendations.  Atty Volan responds.  Def makes stmt.  Court heard and imposes sentence as follows:

Count 2:

w/held sentence
2 yrs probation
90 days DCJ w/h&t as COP cons. to current sentence
no unsupervised contact w/minor females
no sexual contact w/minors
counseling if agent deems necessary
obtain HS diploma/GED/HSED 
maintain full-time employment or be enrolled in school
court costs
DNA sample

Court schedules restitution hearing
  Restitution hearing scheduled for January 19, 2016 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Anthony L. Walstra in court with attorney Greg E. Vollan.  Gilbert Grant Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Review of info is waived; not guilty plea entered; 20 days mtns; stc set; bail con't

Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact or communication with alleged victim, M.L.M., dob 11/28/01 or her residence.  Defendant shall not go on the premises at Beaver Dam Middle School or Beaver Dam High School.

Defendant Anthony L. Walstra in custody via video with attorney Greg E. Vollan (will appoint). Intern Kevin Schmidt (Sempf) appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges, penalties and right to Preliminary Hearing. Court finds probable cause. State heard on bond; Prelim requested waiving time limits. Prelim 9/10/15 at 1:30pm in Br. 3; Court sets $5,000 PA Bond with conditions:  Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact or communication with alleged victim, MLM, dob 11/28/01 or her residence;   Defendant shall not go on the premises of Beaver Dam Middle School or Beaver Dam High School.
